definition[0]: to charge someone with a crime and try to show that they are guilty of it in a court of law
example[1]: The company is to be prosecuted under the Health and Safety Act.
note[0]: prosecute somebody under a law/Act etc
example[2]: Buxton is being prosecuted for assault.
definition[1]: if a lawyer prosecutes a case, he or she tries to prove that the person charged with a crime is guilty
example[3]: Mrs Lynn Smith, prosecuting, said the offence took place on January 27.
example[4]: We cannot prosecute the investigation further.
definition[3]: if the state authorities prosecute someone, they officially say that person must be judged by a court of law for a particular crime
example[5]: Shoplifters  (=people who steal things from shops) will be prosecuted.
example[6]: Johnson is being prosecuted for an offence under the Trade Descriptions Act.
example[7]: The attorney prosecuting the case refused to comment on the trial.
